result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Request for Substitution of Judge

Adjustment Number: 22A 140259,

No contact with victim(s):  S.B. except through app "Talking Parents" on issues, re: child care.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Third party child exchange through Linda Otalora.  Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

Clerk: Amanda.

Date and Time set for IA; VRCW.

Atty Rotter will be filing for substitution. 

PLEA:  NOT GUILTY.

- No contact with victim(s): S.B., except through app "Talking Parents" on issues re: child care. Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
